byline.contributor: Aurelien Breeden reported from Paris, and Sewell Chan from London.
byline.original: By AURELIEN BREEDEN and SEWELL CHAN

abstract: Belgium officials apprehend third man in connection with thwarted plan to mount major terrorist attack in France; man, identified only by initials Y A, is charged as accomplice to Frenchman Reda Kriket; authorities also announce Brussels airport will reopen after March 22 bombings.
lead_paragraph: The 33-year-old Belgian was charged with participation in the activities of a terrorist group, the federal prosecutor’s office said Saturday.

headline.main: Third Man Is Charged in Belgium Over Foiled Plot in France
headline.print_headline: Third Man Is Charged in Belgium in French Plot

snippet: The 33-year-old Belgian was charged with participation in the activities of a terrorist group, the federal prosecutor’s office said Saturday.
